body_html:
Hey @F3PiX, can you give me an example where the dates are hardcoded? If they are, that feels like a bug. Do you refer to app/models/season.rb:28? The default values are only set if we didn't pass something else (ie. via the seasons form). The default values are in place to ensure we always have a working season with a meaningful dates without the need to edit them first (e.g. after a fresh checkout of the app).

That being said, a developer-mode to quickly switch between seasons would be super lecker of course!

body:
Hey @F3PiX, can you give me an example where the dates are hardcoded? If they are, _that_ feels like a bug. Do you refer to [app/models/season.rb:28](https://github.com/rails-girls-summer-of-code/rgsoc-teams/blob/master/app/models/season.rb#L28)? The default values are only set if we didn't pass something else (ie. via the seasons form). The default values are in place to ensure we always have a working season with a meaningful dates without the need to edit them first (e.g. after a fresh checkout of the app).

That being said, a developer-mode to quickly switch between seasons would be super lecker of course!
